tit.cmt: 人名ローマ字表記を修正しました

sen.j: 実忠（じっちゅう、神亀3年（726年） - ?）は、奈良時代の僧。
sen.e: Jitchu (726 - ?) was a Buddhist priest during the Nara period.
Jicchu (726 - year of death unknown) was a Buddhist priest who lived in the Nara period.
sen.cmt: 人名・形式・表現を修正しました。なお、原文に人名読みが「じつちゅう」とありましたが、「つ」は促音便のほうですので修正しました。参考：http://kotobank.jp/word/%E5%AE%9F%E5%BF%A0
sen.e: Jicchu (726 - year of death unknown) was a Buddhist priest who lived in the Nara period.

sen.j: 良弁に師事して華厳を学び、760年（天平宝字4年）目代となる。
sen.e: Became a pupil of Roben and studied the Kegon sect of Buddhism then, in 760 became his deputy.
He became a pupil of Roben and studied Kegon (Huayan [Flower Garland] Buddhism), and then in 760, became his master's mokudai (deputy).
sen.cmt: 用語・表現を修正しました
sen.e: He became a pupil of Roben and studied Kegon (Huayan [Flower Garland] Buddhism), and then in 760, became his master's mokudai (deputy).

sen.j: 東大寺を始め奈良西大寺・西隆寺の造営に参画した。
sen.e: Commencing with Todai-ji temple, he took part in the planning of construction of Nara Saidai-ji temple (Nara City) and Sairyu-ji temple.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Commencing with Todai-ji Temple, he took part in the planning of construction of Saidai-ji Temple and Sairyu-ji Temple in Nara.
sen.cmt: 原文のリンク先表示を削除しました。用語を修正しました。翻訳者の手による原文文末を修正しました。
sen.e: Commencing with Todai-ji Temple, he took part in the planning of construction of Saidai-ji Temple and Sairyu-ji Temple in Nara.

sen.j: 東大寺大仏光背の造作や、百万塔を収める小塔殿・頭塔（土でできた塔）の造営を行った。
sen.e: He had the halo made for Todaiji`s great statue of Buddha as well as supplying 100 million miniature pottery pagodas objects.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He had the halo made for the Great Buddha at Todai-ji Temple, Nara, as well as building a Shotoden to store the Hyakumanto (known as the Hyakumanto Dharani: the one million pagodas and Dharani prayers) and Zuto (pyramid-like pagoda made of clay and stone).
sen.cmt: 誤解釈につき、再訳出しました。百万塔訳語参考：http://www.wdl.org/en/item/2927/ 頭塔訳語参考：http://narashikanko.jp/english/kan_spot_data/e_si155.html
sen.e: He had the halo made for the Great Buddha at Todai-ji Temple, Nara, as well as building a Shotoden to store the Hyakumanto (known as the Hyakumanto Dharani: the one million pagodas and Dharani prayers) and Zuto (pyramid-like pagoda made of clay and stone).

sen.j: その後、東大寺少鎮・三綱のうちの寺主及び上座・造寺所知事などを歴任し、東大寺の実務面で大いに活躍した。
sen.e: Subsequently, he was made chief priest of Todaiji (a position ranked between the sanko (senior administrator) and assistant temple supervisor (少鎮) role.

Subsequently, he successively held various posts at Todai-ji Temple, including jishu (literally, head priest, referring to director of the temple or abbot), joza (literally, elder or president, referring to an ecclesiastical official, one of the three officials who assumes leadership in the affairs of a monastery) and zojisho-chiji (literally, director of affairs of temple construction department) among Todaiji shochin and sanko (or sango, literally, the three bonds, referring to the directors of a monastery), thus playing an active part in handling practical business matters for the temple.
sen.cmt: 形式・用語を修正しました。原文中「造寺所」とは「造寺司」zojishi (officials in charge of building temples and great Buddhas)のことではないかと思われますが、ここでは原文通りに訳出してあります。 上座定訳参考：Cited from Digital Dictionary of Buddhism: 上座 ecclesiastical officials http://www.buddhism-dict.net/cgi-bin/xpr-ddb.pl?4e.xml+id('b4e0a-5ea7')#ixzz103vs1wj7 「少鎮」定訳不明でした（翻訳者による訳assistant temple supervisorの根拠は、日本語の意味としても英訳としても不明でしたので使用を控えました）。
sen.e: Subsequently, he successively held various posts at Todai-ji Temple, including jishu (literally, head priest, referring to director of the temple or abbot), joza (literally, elder or president, referring to an ecclesiastical official, one of the three officials who assumes leadership in the affairs of a monastery) and zojisho-chiji (literally, director of affairs of temple construction department) among Todaiji shochin and sanko (or sango, literally, the three bonds, referring to the directors of a monastery), thus playing an active part in handling practical business matters for the temple.

sen.j: 東大寺二月堂の十一面悔過会（けかえ）（通称お水取り）は実忠が始めたものとされる。
sen.e: Jitchu was the one who commenced the Juichimen Kannon Keka-e (the repentance ceremony of Eleven-faced Kannon) ceremony at Todai-ji temple's Nigatsu-do pavilion.

Jicchu was supposedly the one who commenced the Juichimen [Kannon] Keka-e (the repentance ceremony of Eleven-faced Kannon, commonly known as shuni-e or Omizutori) at the Nigatsu-do (literally, hall of the second month) of the Todai-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 用語・表現を修正しました
sen.e: Jicchu was supposedly the one who commenced the Juichimen [Kannon] Keka-e (the repentance ceremony of Eleven-faced Kannon, commonly known as shuni-e or Omizutori) at the Nigatsu-do (literally, hall of the second month) of the Todai-ji Temple.

sen.j: 著書には、815年（弘仁6年）一生のうちに自らがたずさわった事業を列記した「東大寺権別当実忠二十九ヶ条」がある。
sen.e: His writings include a work `東大寺権別当実忠二十九ヶ条` dated 815 where he enumerates the work he undertook during his lifetime

His writings include "Todaiji gon-no-betto Jicchu nijukyu kajo" (literally, the 29 rules prescribed by Jicchu, Acting Chief of the Todai-ji Temple) dated 815, where he enumerated the work he had undertaken during his lifetime.
sen.cmt: 用語・形式を修正しました。書名は定訳不明です。
sen.e: His writings include "Todaiji gon-no-betto Jicchu nijukyu kajo" (literally, the 29 rules prescribed by Jicchu, Acting Chief of the Todai-ji Temple) dated 815, where he enumerated the work he had undertaken during his lifetime.
